DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Reporting Error Message Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to represent an error message from caAERS (cancer Adverse Event Expedited Reporting System) for rules failure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used._The act of providing a short account._A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition._A usually short communication transmitted by words, signals, or other means from one person, station, or group to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:The act of providing a short account.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The act of providing a short account.

Property.preferredDefinition: A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.:A usually short communication transmitted by words, signals, or other means from one person, station, or group to another.

Concepts.definition: A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.
A usually short communication transmitted by words, signals, or other means from one person, station, or group to another.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
